name: ConditionalTableRowStyle
desc: The object for applying styles to table rows that meet certain conditions.

items.name: backgroundColor
items.desc: The background color for the row.If this property is omitted, the background is transparent.The cellâ€™s background color is highest priority, followed by column, and finally row. All three colors are applied, meaning that non-opaque values can cause combined colors. For example, using a red row together with a blue column, both with 50% opacity, creates a purple cell.

items.name: divider
items.desc: The stroke style for the divider line below the row.

items.name: height
items.desc: The height of the row, as a number in points, or using one of the available units of measure for components. See Specifying Measurements for Components.By default, the height of each row is determined by the height of the content in that row.

items.name: selectors
items.desc: An array of one or more selectors, each of which specifies one or more conditions.This conditional table row style will be applied to rows that meet all of the conditions of at least one of these selectors.
